page.title: 08GARDENS OF INTEREST IN RHU.
page.content: Although most gardens are well tended and attractive some,especially those belonging to the mansion houses,are of particular interest to the public. "Woodcote",in Rhu,is noted for its array of most unusual plants,shrubs and trees including a plant which is over 300 years old, brought originally from Inverary churchyard and a very rare Red Oak tree,of which we are told there are only 2 in Britain.Glenarn House,also in Rhu has a most beautiful garden noted particularly for its many different species of rhododendron and azalea bushes.Both of these gardens have been opened to the public, the former on the basis of once every alternate year with proceeds going to a local charity and the latter,although not at present,was open regularly in the past and hopes to re_open in the near future.
